title: Primary Password
content:
I forgot my "primary password" so I reset my password twice today. However, the browser pop up window keeps asking me for my "primary password" and this pop up window will not accept the new passwords. I also deleted Firefox from my computer and re-downloaded it, but this did not help. I attached a picture of this pop up window that has not updated even after I reset my password. I also cannot log out and log back into my firefox account in my browser without entering this password.

Is there anything else I can do? I understand that my data will be lost when I reset the primary password.
creator: graham.pergande

title: Common auto parts site freezes when opened.
content: I do mechanical work and frequent numerous part source sites. In the past month, 2 common national sites (AutoZone and Advance Auto Parts) will open to their normal opening site with numerous options to click on such as what part do you need...what specials are, etc. That opening site is "frozen" and will not accept searches or ANY navigation on site. You cannot even close (X) the site...and I must shut down the desktop to escape. I called both national sites and they had no clue what I was talking about. I tried a different search engine (Google not Duck Go) but still after initially opening these 2 sites...they remain frozen. I then downloaded Google Chrome...and that fixed the problem. Both AutoZone and Advance Auto Parts now open... and function normally. Back on FireFox I tried opening the NAPA Auto Parts (who I rarely use) and their site opens and functions normally. My question: Why is Autozone and Advance Auto Parts not usable with Firefox for me ? I navigate hundreds of sites and forums a week with Firefox without problem. I have been using Firefox and visiting those 2 parts sites for Years with FireFox... and no problem. I reloaded newest version of Firefox ...and that didn't fix the problem. Any ideas ? Thanks, Ken
creator: lindahillsmustang

title: Compatibility and Security on our NEW UK User Owned Network
content:
As I log into my Firefox account, I receive login related e-mails but then experience system failures as I attempt to action the links in these e-mails (declaring incorrect security code!)! Clearly a web compatibility issue, details substantually beyond my knowledge! As a result, I am UNABLE to access substantual parts of Mozilla / Firefox website and therefore CANNOT report these in the most appropriate place!

I DO NOT know if the technical issues are related to North Yorkshire library systems, Leeds library systems or technicalities related to our NEW user owned communications at www.midcounties.coop / www.phonecoop.coop !

I therefore ask Mozilla UK to join our UK communications co-operative in order to give technical guidance on the security of our network and e-mailer (bringing it up to ideal standard) and to steer UK communications in the direction of an "Open to all, Free to use" profile, as I understand has already been done in some states of America, detail beyond my knowledge.
creator: APhillipson

title: Synced tabs disappear after logging into two different devices
content:
So I had a laptop that had to go under repair (device A), so had to use a different computer (device B). I sign into Firefox, and I can see the synced tabs from device A. For various reasons, the very next day I had to transfer to another computer (device C), so I logout of device B, and login into Firefox in device C. The synced tabs are no longer visible, even though in my account it says device A is still connected to the sync.

Bookmarks and such still load up just fine, I just can't see the device A synced tabs at all. Any clue why this is happening?

Also, is it normal that my email is still showing on the device B menu? Even though it says I logged out successfully, and device B is not showing in sync anymore, in the actual computer it's still showing on the menu above the "new tab" option. How do I remove my email from showing in that particular browse? Uninstall the program entirely?

title: last 2 Firefox updates have each broken some of my scripts
content:
After making a jump to FF 105, my virtual bookmark function started landing on different places each time I invoked it, even though I wasn't changing the window.pageYOffset value. Now after updating to FF 106, where I had the option of setting that value using the onLoad option, the page remains absolutely blank until I confirm or reject the window.pageYOffset value. Since I cannot see where on the page I am positioned (because it won't finish loading) it is now useless. This tool had been my most frequently used function for many years as I could reposition to a desired location by merely pressing my home key. OnKeydown it would jump to the top of the page and onKeyUp, it would return me to virtual bookmarked position, no matter where I was on the page. For some of my pages, I would invoke it more than once in less than a minute. It was really useful!. (Now it is useless!) These problems happened immediately after each FF update. 

 /russ
creator: csuflinux

title: Bookmark: Sort by Name is unreliable
content:
When right clicking a bookmark folder and sorting, it only "sort-of" works. This looks to be a defect in the sort algorithm employed, as the results are quite random.

Let's say you have 5 bookmarks named: - eee - ddd - bbb - aaa - ccc

After sorting, you'd expect the following: - aaa - bbb - ccc - ddd - eee

However, what actually happens is that "sometimes" a few are out of place. i.e. - aaa - ccc - ddd - bbb - eee

When resorting this, it may not fix it entirely - since the behaviour seems to be random, resulting in a different entry being in the wrong place: - aaa - ccc - bbb - ddd - eee

I've noticed it's hard to reproduce for smaller folders (i.e. < 10 bookmarks in the folder), but very easy to reproduce on larger folders (i.e. 100+ bookmarks).
creator: fatotaku

title: New features on Firefox 106.0.1
content:
Hi! Yesterday my Firefox was updated to the lasted version, 106.0.1 on Windows 10. As we know, to be applied all changes it's require a restart, after that, when the Firefox start, launch a step by step to show and remark the new features in the application.

From all new features I would like to remark 2, for me awesome features:

  1. Hidden Tabs
  2. Group Tabs.

The first one will be great, also the information about tabs that show, but I can not find how I can to hide new tabs. How is it possible?

The last one also was awesome, I can grouping tabs and minimize a group of tabs and only focus in a few tabs.

Today only found a Containers. I have not installed Firefox Containers Add-ons. The functionality that I found today is not the same. With container I can not move an opened tab to container, required to be opened in a container. The login information is not share, the behavior is the same a new instance of Firefox. In yesterday feature, I can drag and drop tabs to be grouped, also "minimize" and the appearance is similar to "Firefox View" in "Hidden Tabs" and with double click expand all tabs grouped. I would like to recover that functionality. Thanks in advance!

title: Cookies and Site Data Exceptions
content:
I want Grammarly.com to be the only website to keep my Cookies and Site Data so I can stay logged into my account even when closing and reopening Firefox.

The steps I have taken are as follows... Under the "History" section, I have turned on all history deleting options. Then under "Cookies and Site Data" I turned on "Delete cookies and site data when Firefox is closed" then I chose "Manage Exceptions" to add Grammarly.com and all other known links of that website to prevent or "...except" that particular website to keep my cookies/data so it won't log me out etc. However, when I close Firefox and/or restart my computer, I get logged out, and my "Manage Exceptions" list I added the Grannarly.com links to is empty, as if it got reset or deleted.

If you need more info in order to help me with this, let me know.

Thank you

-Joe
creator: Joe176
